newsitem.title: USA: Tenneco to buy back up $340 million of its shares.
newsitem.headline: Tenneco to buy back up $340 million of its shares.

text.p: Tenneco Inc., which has stakes in packaging and automotive parts, said Monday its board approved a new stock repurchase programme that will allow it to buy back up to 5 percent of its outstanding shares, or 8.5 million shares worth $340 million at Friday's closing price.

"This action reflects our belief that Tenneco stock represents an excellent investment, based on the strong fundamentals of our automotive parts and packaging businesses," said Dana Mead, Tenneco chairman and chief executive officer.
In 1995 and 1996 Tenneco repurchased $750 million of its stock.
Tenneco said it will begin the buyback immediately and the rate of repurchase will depend on market and business factors.
Tenneco's stock was up 12.5 cents at $39.50 on the New York Stock Exchange.
